title: Data Consultant (SA/WA/NT)
description:
The Australian Research Data Commons (ARDC) is a transformational initiative that is enabling access to nationally significant, leading edge data intensive eInfrastructure, platforms, skills and collections of high-quality data for the Australian research community and industry.

The purpose of the ARDC is to provide Australian researchers with a competitive advantage through data.

We are looking to welcome to the team an experienced and highly effective individual to the position of Data Consultant . You will understand the research sector in Western Australia, South Australia and the Northern Territory.  You will have experience working in a commonwealth funded research environment and be able to bring your skills and knowledge to the role to help advance the ARDC’s mission in WA, SA and the NT.

The purpose of this key role is to work at international, national, and local levels with current and prospective partners to communicate ARDC’s capabilities, identify upcoming research challenges and potential solutions, and build communities that promote best practice in activities relating to ARDC’s data, platform, infrastructure, and skills programs.

In this role you will experience a diverse range of exciting challenges in a unique and fast paced environment.  We can guarantee that no day will be the same!

The ideal candidate will have a PhD or comparable experience working in academic research and/or a thorough understanding of the research process. They will have worked in or closely with (local/national/international) research organisations and facilities and will have successfully engaged with diverse groups of stakeholders within institutions, research facilities and/or research groups.

On offer is a competitive remuneration package depending on the successful candidates skills and experience. This role is employed through the University of Adelaide and is based in Adelaide. While this role is primarily based in South Australia it is also responsible for WA and NT engagements and some national programs and domestic and international travel may be required.

You can access the Position Description here:

https://bit.ly/ARDCdataconsultant

If you would like to find out more about the role please contact:

Keith Russell, Manager Engagements on 0427 452 342 or via email keith.russell@ardc.edu.au

title: Data and Performance Analyst
description:
About the Role

As an expert in data analytics and with a specialist knowledge of various business intelligence tools, you will analyse and interpret complex data sets to provide innovative solutions that support university-wide performance monitoring, decision-making and compliance reporting activities. You will design, develop, and manage projects to support strategic decision making, and continually review and improve a suite of core performance reports and data analysis tools that are aligned with the University’s strategy.

You will lead the development and implementation of a quality training program for professional and academic staff and be highly skilled in the presentation of multifaceted data sets to a range of audiences.

About UniSA

The University of South Australia is Australia’s University of Enterprise. Our culture of innovation is anchored around global and national links to academic, research and industry partners. Our graduates are the new urban professionals, global citizens at ease with the world and ready to create and respond to change. Our research is inventive and adventurous and we create new knowledge that is central to global economic and social prosperity.

Core Responsibilities

  • Analyse and interpret qualitative and quantitative data through the application of various business intelligence tools
  • Provide specialist advice on institutional and market information for strategic planning, institutional benchmarking, and university-wide performance measurement
  • Evaluate, prioritise, and respond to data requests from key internal and external stakeholders
  • Utilise a variety of methods and tools to interpret and present complex data and information to audiences at all levels
  • Develop and maintain effective business partnerships, using a consultancy approach


Essential Skills and Experience

  • Relevant tertiary qualification and experience in a relevant field, or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education
  • Expertise in the use of Business Intelligence tools and statistical techniques
  • Ability to extract, manage and manipulate complex datasets
  • High level writing and presentation skills, and ability to present information in a clear and concise manner
  • Well-developed business partnership skills, with experience in negotiating and problem-solving with clients


Benefits

Getting a great job working with the best is just the start. UniSA rewards its staff with a wide variety of benefits such as:

  • Access to great personal development opportunities
  • Generous superannuation contributions of 17%
  • Flexible working conditions
  • Employee assistance and development programs
  • A range of salary packaging options, including vehicle leasing, laptops and car parking fees


Culture

As a University of Enterprise, we offer a dynamic and agile workplace culture, one that embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Our staff are creative and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm. We embrace diversity and inclusion in a vibrant, engaging environment. Our people are authentic, resilient, and influential, and we deliver results.

For a copy of the position description and to apply, please visit Working at UniSA. The online application form will list the specific selection criteria that you need to address.

Please address your cover letter to Jade Windsor, Senior Consultant: Recruitment Central . For further information about the position or the recruitment process, please contact UniSA Recruitment Central on +61 8 8302 1700 or via email at recruitment@unisa.edu.au using job reference number 4029 .

Applications welcomed from Australian or NZ citizens, Australian permanent residents and those who have the legal right to work in Australia for the term of appointment.

title: Technical Business Analyst
description:
Technical Business Analyst

Who we are

Daitum is an Australian AI scaleup on a mission to enable decision-makers in any organisation to make better business decisions. Our SaaS platform utilises state-of-the-art AI to finally allow decision makers to make the right call – all the time. Think areas like staff rostering, production scheduling, inventory management or logistics: Daitum crunches the numbers, compares millions of options and recommends an optimised course of action in no time.

Daitum’s mission is to remove all technical barriers that stand in the way of the widespread adoption of this awesome technology. Our team is made up of dedicated and intelligent individuals who believe in our mission, and who have an innovative mindset to bring that vision to life.

What you will work on

An integral member of the Customer Success team, you will be responsible for setting up Daitum’s cloud-based optimisation software to address specific customer needs.

Daitum’s software is highly configurable and can be set up to model any operational problem. You will work with customers and internal stakeholders to understand the customer’s unique operational requirements. Using your strong analytical and problem-solving skills, you will design and implement the optimisation model required to meet the customers’ requirements, possibly establishing and ensuring adoption of new user workflows in the process.

You will provide production support to ensure model implementations maximise the customer’s business value over time. Eventually you will own one or more of the standard domain models, becoming an expert in its capabilities and extending it to deliver more and more value to our customer base.

Who you are

You must be flexible, proactive, and have a passion for technology-based products. Strong analytical skills are essential. This is an excellent opportunity for someone looking to break into high-growth startups. You will have the opportunity to influence Daitum’s product roadmap and meaningfully level up the efficiency of our execution and delivery. Effective communication skills are essential to promote close collaboration with both Daitum’s customers and our technical team.

Nuts & bolts

This role is permanent full-time and based in Australia. Our headquarters are in Adelaide, with team members working a mixed office / remote. This role is Adelaide-based.

We offer:

  • A mixed office/from-home work arrangement
  • Opportunities for professional development and career advancement
  • Employee incentive schemes and equity in the company
  • Remote position or relocation support for the right candidate

Apply here by submitting your resume and a cover letter summarising your experience, outlining why you are interested in this role, and identifying how you believe you can contribute to our team. Only applicants with a cover letter will be considered.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
About the role:

The Senior Data Analyst will contribute to the agencies strategic approach to data and insights, which includes delivering statistical advices, analyses and publications. The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for working with disparate data sources, including financial, demographic and geospatial data sources, to extract, consolidate and analyse regulatory data for different audiences, internal and external to AFSA.

As the Senior Data Analyst, you will:

  • Actively contribute to the Data Analytics Section’s commitment to delivering high quality statistical advices, timely reports and the development of regulatory program insights.
  • Support the Assistant Director of Data Analytics to deliver statistical publications, data quality initiatives, data integrity and data analyses to internal and external stakeholders.
  • Interpret data requirements and extract regulatory program data to service ad-hoc data requests and support the development of data-driven insights.
  • Analyse datasets utilising tools like Excel, SQL and other analytical products to contribute to regulatory program insights and data integrity.
  • Develop dashboards, codify business requirements and deliver program insights using PowerBI and/or Tableau.
  • Apply data storytelling skills and communicate effectively with a diverse range of stakeholders from both technical and non-technical backgrounds.
  • Actively contribute to data sharing activities and promote data linkage initiatives by applying current privacy and data governance practices.

About you

To be successful in this role, you will have:

  • A tertiary qualification in applied finance, engineering, mathematics, statistics or other quantitative discipline.
  • Demonstrated experience (3 – 6 years) working as a Data Analyst in the financial services, regulation or other related industry delivering reports and publications.
  • Strong data storytelling and data visualisation skills, with the ability to communicate findings to a range of stakeholders.
  • Strong understanding of data management best practices and the Australian public data system.
  • Demonstrated competence in data analysis and statistical modelling using tools such as Stata, SAS, R, Python etc is desirable but not essential.

Why AFSA?

You will enjoy excellent conditions including generous superannuation (15.4%), a modern work environment, and flexibility to balance work and personal life.

We are a workplace committed to providing an environment that values diversity and supports staff to reach their full potential.

We encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, peoples from culturally diverse backgrounds and people with disabilities.

If you are a highly motivated, enthusiastic person and have a desire to contribute to a professional and inclusive team then apply now.

title: Logistics Analyst
description:
We’re on a quest to improve everyday life for millions of people and the world around us. To reinvent the way we cook, clean, and care. It is embodied in everything we do. Every idea, product and human interaction. The trend hunters who want to revolutionise the fashion industry. The foodies who strive to make taste an experience. The health enthusiasts who search for ways to make our environment even cleaner and brighter for today and the future.

Join us to create solutions and experiences that enrich daily lives and the health of our planet.

Your Role

Carefully planning and running the logistics schedules as part of a close-knit team, you will also balance the needs of stakeholders and colleagues across all functions to ensure the efficient transportation of products. It’s a dynamic, responsible role that requires a flexible approach to changing priorities, delivering solutions and looking ahead to see how we can deliver even better for our customers. You will have an up-to-date view of production and material in transit as well as business strategic priorities to ensure financial goals are met.

A Typical Day

As a Logistics Analyst you will be responsible for logistics planning to ensure the smooth flow of internal and external material for Dudley Park manufacturing operations. Your objective will be to ensure high levels of customer service ensuring Electrolux meets its financial goals through scheduling and delivery of materials on time to production.  You will be part of various functions within the logistics team that may involve Kanban scheduling, electronic ordering, scheduling, shortage reporting and follow up. Your day may include:

  • Prepare and review low stock reports
  • Create, review and analyse component requirements
  • Monitor goods receiving
  • Manage Direct to Site suppliers
  • Follow through urgent order from point of dispatch to line side delivery
  • Monitor stock and correct stock discrepancies
  • Maintain record of supplier decks and maintain supplier deck details
  • Maintain accurate Logistics Lead times within the corporate database
  • Manage cost KPI’s as per Business Plan Development
  • Periodically review freight methods and rates for most practical and cost- effective methods
  • Prepare stock reports
  • Report on shortages to the factory through the daily components meeting
  • Liaise and work closely with other departments including Production, Manufacturing Engineering and Purchasing

Core Competencies

Agile – You work with urgency, analysing and adapting to different situations, quickly understanding changes and reacting confidently and decisively.

Analytical – With an eye for detail and the ability to interpret complex data, you can also translate this into meaningful, useful information that informs decision-making.

A Self-Starter – You can join the dots to take us from where we are to where we want to be, mapping the clear routes and strategies essential to achieving our goals.

Organised – You set the pace and the priorities, and then you bring a methodical approach to meeting your goals.

Collaborative – You build trust, good working relationships and communicate effectively with your colleagues and across functions.

Who You Are

  • Good working knowledge of global shipping practices
  • Experience in a global project involving multiple stakeholders including suppliers, freight forwarders via web-based applications
  • Ability to work under pressure
  • Good planning and organisational skills
  • Tertiary qualification in logistics, material planning or similar discipline
  • Computer skills with high competence level in Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, Word, Access etc

Keeping you Healthy and Safe

We want you to return home in even better shape than when you started, so we need you to help us do this by making sure you follow a few simple steps. We need you to:

  • Make sure you take reasonable care for your own health and safety, and
  • Take reasonable care that what you do (or what you don’t do when you should have) doesn’t affect the health and safety of others, and
  • Follow reasonable instructions that we might give from time-to-time, such as reporting incidents and hazards, and
  • Follow policies or procedures, so long as it’s reasonable and we’ve told you about it, and
  • Attend training that helps you to work safely

Company Description

Electrolux is a leading global appliance company that has shaped living for the better for more than 100 years. We reinvent taste, care and wellbeing experiences for millions of people, always striving to be at the forefront of sustainability in society through our solutions and operations. Under our brands, including Electrolux, AEG and Frigidaire, we sell approximately 60 million household products in approximately 120 markets every year. In 2020 Electrolux had sales of SEK 116 billion and employed 48,000 people around the world. For more information go to www.electroluxgroup.com.

title: Advance Technology Foresight Analyst EL 1 (S&T Level 5)
description:
The Role

The Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG) is offering two permanent positions as an Advanced Technology Foresight Analyst.

You will develop a sound understanding of a broad range of technologies, including current technologies and those that may be developed in the future. You will work with planners and operations analysts to foresee how these technologies might strengthen or weaken Australia’s national interests.

One position, located in Canberra, will focus on national security and the way it may operate in the future, including foreseeing disruptions or entirely new concepts of operations. The other position, located in Melbourne will focus on Defence capabilities, including foreseeing disruptions or entirely new capabilities. Although the positions are based in Canberra and Melbourne, we are open to the idea of having our candidate work from our in Edinburgh, SA.

The role involves desk-based technical research and analysis as part of a large team responsible for providing emerging technology and foresight advice to Defence and other government departments. You will be responsible for a technical area that corresponds to your current S&T skills, and will broaden your expertise into a range of fields relevant to Defence (for example AI, cyber, biotechnology, quantum and many others).

You will be trained in role-specific analytic skills, including data analytics and foresight techniques. You will develop a deep understanding of the structure and decision-making processes of the Defence Department, to ensure your advice is tailored to have an impact. You will develop into a communications expert, able to concisely explain technical issues to busy, non-technical stakeholders. Outputs will include written reports, verbal briefings, multi-media and infographics. The role requires building networks across our own team of experts, as well as broader DSTG, Defence and intelligence.

About our Team

The technology analyst team is a part of the Defence Impacts of Emerging Technology (DIET) Group, within Strategy and Joint Force (SJF) Major Science and Technology Capability (MSTC), which is itself within the Joint and Operations Analysis Division of the Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG).

This team is organised under DSTG’s Strategic Futures Project, and works closely with the Critical Technology Foresight (CTF) Group. You will be joining a project team of approximately 25 staff, including technology analysts (like this position), experts in tools and methods (such as AI experts who write programs to assist the analysts) and social scientists (who evaluate the impact of technology on society).

The Strategic Futures Project is a centre of gravity within government for emerging technology and foresight advice. Our advice feeds into decision-making, such as for senior Defence committees, the Department’s S&T portfolio planning and capability planning for the ADF. We play a key role in whole-of-government decision-making via our strong linkages to the Critical Technology Policy Coordination Office in PM&C. We partner with DSTG’s 2000 experts, across Defence, policy and intelligence agencies, and with international experts.

Our team is passionate, professional, welcoming and inclusive.

Our Ideal Candidate

We are seeking an Australian citizen who is naturally curious and motivated to develop broad expertise across diverse emerging technologies. Candidates from all S&T disciplines will be considered, but we especially seek experts in the physical sciences, engineering or systems analysis. We seek science-communicators who are passionate about making an impact for the nation. Ideally you will have experience in the APS, or have been responsible for leading and delivering projects in academia or industry. A pre-existing interest in Defence is not required, but you must be open to developing this.

S&T 5 level jobs are typically suitable for mid-career professionals rather than entry level jobs for graduates. You will have no formal responsibilities for supervising staff, but you will be expected to show leadership and take responsibility for driving outcomes and enhancing the capabilities of our team.

A PhD or equivalent qualifications/experience is required.

title: Advance Technology Foresight Analyst EL 1 (S&T Level 5)
description:
The Role

The Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG) is offering two permanent positions as an Advanced Technology Foresight Analyst.

You will develop a sound understanding of a broad range of technologies, including current technologies and those that may be developed in the future. You will work with planners and operations analysts to foresee how these technologies might strengthen or weaken Australia’s national interests.

One position, located in Canberra, will focus on national security and the way it may operate in the future, including foreseeing disruptions or entirely new concepts of operations. The other position, located in Melbourne will focus on Defence capabilities, including foreseeing disruptions or entirely new capabilities. Although the positions are based in Canberra and Melbourne, we are open to the idea of having our candidate work from our in Edinburgh, SA.

The role involves desk-based technical research and analysis as part of a large team responsible for providing emerging technology and foresight advice to Defence and other government departments. You will be responsible for a technical area that corresponds to your current S&T skills, and will broaden your expertise into a range of fields relevant to Defence (for example AI, cyber, biotechnology, quantum and many others).

You will be trained in role-specific analytic skills, including data analytics and foresight techniques. You will develop a deep understanding of the structure and decision-making processes of the Defence Department, to ensure your advice is tailored to have an impact. You will develop into a communications expert, able to concisely explain technical issues to busy, non-technical stakeholders. Outputs will include written reports, verbal briefings, multi-media and infographics. The role requires building networks across our own team of experts, as well as broader DSTG, Defence and intelligence.

About our Team

The technology analyst team is a part of the Defence Impacts of Emerging Technology (DIET) Group, within Strategy and Joint Force (SJF) Major Science and Technology Capability (MSTC), which is itself within the Joint and Operations Analysis Division of the Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG).

This team is organised under DSTG’s Strategic Futures Project, and works closely with the Critical Technology Foresight (CTF) Group. You will be joining a project team of approximately 25 staff, including technology analysts (like this position), experts in tools and methods (such as AI experts who write programs to assist the analysts) and social scientists (who evaluate the impact of technology on society).

The Strategic Futures Project is a centre of gravity within government for emerging technology and foresight advice. Our advice feeds into decision-making, such as for senior Defence committees, the Department’s S&T portfolio planning and capability planning for the ADF. We play a key role in whole-of-government decision-making via our strong linkages to the Critical Technology Policy Coordination Office in PM&C. We partner with DSTG’s 2000 experts, across Defence, policy and intelligence agencies, and with international experts.

Our team is passionate, professional, welcoming and inclusive.

Our Ideal Candidate

We are seeking an Australian citizen who is naturally curious and motivated to develop broad expertise across diverse emerging technologies. Candidates from all S&T disciplines will be considered, but we especially seek experts in the physical sciences, engineering or systems analysis. We seek science-communicators who are passionate about making an impact for the nation. Ideally you will have experience in the APS, or have been responsible for leading and delivering projects in academia or industry. A pre-existing interest in Defence is not required, but you must be open to developing this.

S&T 5 level jobs are typically suitable for mid-career professionals rather than entry level jobs for graduates. You will have no formal responsibilities for supervising staff, but you will be expected to show leadership and take responsibility for driving outcomes and enhancing the capabilities of our team.

A PhD or equivalent qualifications/experience is required.

title: AH-MAZING Marketing Data Analyst/Paid Media Buyer

We’re determined to have a positive social and environmental impact and understand that we have an opportunity to do more than just create nutritious, drool-worthy health food supplements—we’re here to build connection, encourage growth, and sprinkle our feel-good vibes everywhere, so it creates a ripple effect across the globe!
